message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it deals with the robustness of classifiers to various kinds of random noise models. It also considers linear classifiers as well as deep neural networks, which are commonly studied in the field of machine learning. 

It could also belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision) as classifiers are often used in computer vision tasks such as image classification and object detection. 

Additionally, it could be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as machine learning is a subfield of AI. 

The paper also involves analyzing the decision boundaries of classifiers, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as decision boundaries are important in security-related applications such as intrusion detection. 

Finally, the paper could be categorized under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as it deals with deep neural networks and their robustness to noise.
